passage_text: 1 Stir in the stock, tomatoes, tomato paste and thyme. 2  Place the lid on the slow cooker and cook for 3-4 hours on HIGH or 7-8 hours on LOW. 3  Stir in the peas 15 to 20 minutes before serving and cook on HIGH. Method (Serves 6). 1  Pre-heat the slow cooker on HIGH for 20 minutes. 2  Meanwhile, in a large frypan, heat the olive oil and brown the beef in small batches over high heat for a couple of minutes. 3  Layer carrots, celery, potatoes and onions in the bottom of the slow cooker bowl.

1 Set your slow cooker to high. 2  Add 500ml or so of your stock. 3  Put the potatoes in first, followed by all other veg. 4  Cut the beef into cubes and place in last. 5  Top up with stock until just covering meat. 6  Cook for 4-6 hours, adding dumplings 45 minutes before the end. For the beef casserole: 1  Set your slow cooker to high. 2  Add 500ml or so of your stock. 3  Put the potatoes in first, followed by all other veg. 4  Cut the beef into cubes and place in last. 5  Top up with stock until just covering meat

1 Layer carrots, celery, potatoes and onions in the bottom of the slow cooker bowl. 2  Then top with beef, bay leaf and black peppercorns. 3  Stir in the stock, tomatoes, tomato paste and thyme. 4  Place the lid on the slow cooker and cook for 3-4 hours on HIGH or 7-8 hours on LOW. Method (Serves 6). 1  Pre-heat the slow cooker on HIGH for 20 minutes. 2  Meanwhile, in a large frypan, heat the olive oil and brown the beef in small batches over high heat for a couple of minutes. 3  Layer carrots, celery, potatoes and onions in the bottom of the slow cooker bowl.

Season the onion sauce. Use a 2 to 3 tbsp. of red wine, a bay leaf and some salt and pepper. Pour the sauce into the casserole dish with your beef and add your chopped carrots and potatoes. Cook in the oven. Cook it low and long rather than fast and hot. If you made a recipe with about 2 lbs. of beef, 2 1/2 to 3 hours at 300 degrees Fahrenheit is about right. Add some oil to a pan and heat it well. Brown the beef in the pan and then transfer it to the casserole dish. You can season the beef with salt and pepper or any other spices that you want before you brown it. If making a larger casserole, you may have to brown the beef in several batches.

1 Place the lid on the slow cooker and cook for 3-4 hours on HIGH or 7-8 hours on LOW. 2  Stir in the peas 15 to 20 minutes before serving and cook on HIGH. 3  Taste and adjust seasoning, stir in the parsley and remove bay leaf before serving. Method (Serves 6). 1  Pre-heat the slow cooker on HIGH for 20 minutes. 2  Meanwhile, in a large frypan, heat the olive oil and brown the beef in small batches over high heat for a couple of minutes. 3  Layer carrots, celery, potatoes and onions in the bottom of the slow cooker bowl.

1 Heat oven to 160C/140C fan/gas 3. 2  Put the kettle on. 3  Put the celery, onion, carrots, bay and 1 thyme sprig in a casserole with 1 tbsp oil and the butter. 4  Soften for 10 mins, then stir in the flour until it doesn’t look dusty anymore, followed by the tomato puree, Purée worcestershire sauce and beef stock.  cubes Method. 1

Stir in the stock, then return the beef and bacon to the casserole with the carrots, tomatoes, anchovies, orange zest, bouquet garni, season. Cover with foil and a tight-fitting lid and cook in the oven for 4 hours or until meltingly tender.

1 Then top with beef, bay leaf and black peppercorns. 2  Stir in the stock, tomatoes, tomato paste and thyme. 3  Place the lid on the slow cooker and cook for 3-4 hours on HIGH or 7-8 hours on LOW. 4  Stir in the peas 15 to 20 minutes before serving and cook on HIGH. Method (Serves 6). 1  Pre-heat the slow cooker on HIGH for 20 minutes. 2  Meanwhile, in a large frypan, heat the olive oil and brown the beef in small batches over high heat for a couple of minutes. 3  Layer carrots, celery, potatoes and onions in the bottom of the slow cooker bowl.
